name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending PokÃ©mon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

strengths: Absorb heals while dealing damage for sustainability
Sharp Sickle is energy-efficient at 30 for 2
weaknesses: Only 60 HP for a Stage 2 is very fragile
Stage 2 requiring Mysterious Fossil -> Kabuto -> Kabutops is slow
Absorb requires 4 energy for modest damage
synergies: Defender (help survive to heal with Absorb)
counters: High damage attacks can OHKO despite healing

competitiveHistory: This non-holo version of Kabutops is functionally identical to the holo version (#9). Kabutops struggled competitively due to its poor HP-to-stage ratio at only 60 HP for a Stage 2. The non-holo printing made it more accessible but didn't improve its competitive viability.

rulings.ruling: Absorb's healing is calculated after applying Weakness and Resistance to the damage.
If Absorb does 80 damage (due to Weakness), Kabutops heals 40 damage (half of 80).
Healing is rounded up to the nearest 10, so 30 damage dealt heals 20 (half of 30 is 15, rounds to 20).
Kabutops evolves from Kabuto, which evolves from Mysterious Fossil (a Trainer card that plays as a Basic Pokemon).
